comment.author: 16333811@N00
comment._content: Col. Henry Breckenridge was Asst. Secty of War to President Wilson. Here's an interesting NYT story of him taking $ to London during WWI. He also was Charles Lindbergh's attorney in that famous kidnapping case. www.historicpatterson.org/Exhibits/ExhMiscellaneous.php (scroll down midpage for his info) www.lindberghkidnappinghoax.com/brecks.html

comment.author: 16333811@N00
comment._content: I also question that this was taken by photographers for the Bain News Service, given the Clindedinst studio watermark. However, here are a couple more from that studio, from the NYPL collection: digitalgallery.nypl.org/nypldigital/dgkeysearchdetail.cfm...
